title: React Native E-Commerce Mobile App (The Grove)

goal: The goal of The Grove, an e-commerce mobile app created with React Native, is to provide plant enthusiasts with a seamless and enjoyable shopping experience by offering a diverse selection of plants and stylish pots to enhance their living spaces.
activity: Design & Development: Designed and developed the app using React Native, ensuring a smooth and intuitive user interface.
Feature Implementation: Integrated key features such as product browsing, detailed product pages, cart management, and a checkout process.
Performance Optimization: Ensured the app runs efficiently on both iOS and Android devices by optimizing performance and responsiveness.
User Testing: Conducted user testing sessions to gather feedback and iterated on the design and features based on user input.
outcome: Receiving high positive feedback from users for its user-friendly interface, seamless shopping experience and efficient performance.

title: Solo Indie Game Development: Engine & Programming

goal: Develop a prototype functional game engine with a focus on core functionalities and utilize it to create a basic, playable game as a solo indie developer.
activity: Learn core game development concepts (rendering, physics, game loop, audio, animation, and memory management).
Implement core functionalities within the engine (game loop, rendering, scene management, input handling, collision detection, etc)
Build an entity-component-system for representing entities in the scene.
Build a level-of-detail quad-tree terrain to support both flat-terrain and spherical-terrain for planetary rendering.
Develop an immediate mode graphical-user-interface (GUI) library.
(Optional) Explored additional features like audio, menus, level design, atmospheric scattering, water rendering, custom scripting system and virtual machine, etc.
outcome: Honed software development skills through the development process.
Gained valuable experience in solo game development and the software development lifecycle.

goal: Create a simple 3D project using using prior experience in 3D graphics programming and knowledge gain from the course.
activity: Create an interactive 3D scene with a Christmas theme. Using the OpenGL Graphics API version 2.1 and programming language C++.
Created a fully-realized 3D scene featuring a snowman, table, chairs, rotating ceiling fan, and a free-moving 3D camera that allowed users to explore the scene from any angle.
Notably, all objects in the scene were manually created, demonstrating my strong aptitude for hands-on design and development
outcome: Got an A+ grade for the project.
